comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Heritage Key, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 21236485@N04
comment._content: Fascinating!  Are they teeth?  They look oddly long.

comment.author: 42372915@N03
comment._content:
This x-ray is actually of a wooden coffin that surrounded a cat mummy.  The coffin has remnants of gesso and gilding.  The 'teeth' that you see are really an artifact of the polychrome decoration and gilding - not actual teeth.  The cat mummy is inside the coffin, but for some reason (possibly because of thousands of years) the bundle has compressed, and the bones, and linens are a rather compact square form at the bottom of the coffin and are not visible in this x-ray view.  Poor kitty!

Lisa Bruno, Objects Conservator, Brooklyn Museum

comment.author: 21236485@N04
comment._content: Ahh I see. Thanks for your response.

comment.author: 9526509@N04
comment._content: I often have the desire to mummify my cat.  She won't hold still long enough, unfortunately, and eventually the desire passes.  One day...
